Hi, I’m Kong! I’m around 30 years old, snowed in on a random Saturday, and I decided to start a blog.
About Me#I grew up messing around with computers and phones. Since I learned to read, my dad would buy me computers and tech, believing it would bring me success in life, even though he had no clue what I would do with it. My parents were first-generation immigrants, and our family grew up extremely poor. Because of this, I always tried to maximize what little I had. Instead of buying a RuneScape membership, I followed countless tutorials to run my own private server. Instead of getting a new phone, I flashed custom Android ROMs to unlock new features.
Because of this exposure to tech, when it was time to go to college and pick a “big boy” major, I chose computer science. My reasoning was simple: “I like computers and phones.” I didn’t know exactly what I wanted to do, but I knew it involved tinkering with computers. Fast forward to today, and I am a Senior Software Consultant at a firm in Charlotte, working on new and unique projects.
Why?#One of the biggest challenges in college was the struggle with direction. I didn’t know what was out there, only that I wanted to do something. Even when I figured out a goal, I would get stuck on how to get there. It took countless hours of research (there was no AI back then) to understand the landscape. I often wished for a resource to guide me.
As I’ve matured in my career and life, I see others walking similar paths and asking similar questions. As I listen, I notice common themes:
What should I learn, and where should I invest my time to get where I need to be? How do I break into tech with the odds stacked against me? Am I cooked? Is AI killing my chances? I’ve decided to build this blog as a compilation of questions I’ve been asked about the field, with a sprinkle of my random life lessons and thoughts.
Hopefully, whoever stumbles upon this blog finds some value, whether tech or career-related.
If we did all the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves. -Thomas Edison

title: Introduction

content:
Hello!#My name Kong, like King Kong.
I’m a Senior Software Engineer based here in Charlotte. Most of my days are spent working across the stack—lately with a lot of .NET, Angular, and React. I’ve also been really exploring the possibilities of AI and how I can best optimize it for my own personal workflows.
When I’m not staring at a screen, I’m usually busy with a few other things:
Music & Gear: I’m a total gear head. I own a horde of guitars and am willing to dabble in almost every instrument. It’s my favorite way to switch off the “code brain.”
The Outdoors: I try to get out as much as possible, whether that’s fishing, hoops or pickleball.
Hobbies: I love thrifting for guitar and camera gear. I also collect a little bit of Pokemon!
Photography: I like to explore a lot of different camera gear to document life, trips, and everything in between.
Software development brings out the tinker-er/problem solver in me. I enjoy the “alway can do” motivation when it comes to software.
